reviews.review_text: I’m sort of an expert on this game. With over 9 hours of game time, I’ve spent more time playing this game then most of its developers.

This game isn't next gen, high res and GOTYE quality but it has a charm of its own. It's a re-skin of Left 4 Dead with its own enemies and lore. Sure it's not 'good' by most people standards but if you want to point and shoot, game with friends while not spending too much then this is an intresting little game.  A few game bugs, though.  It's good for the price. I got a 4 pack so I could share it with friends.

This game is an awful knock off of L4D. It's a really low quality game. But damn, is it fun. It's a shoot like crazy kind of game, which would be completely effortless without the extreme consumption of limited ammo. If you want a good game, but left for dead. But if you like shoot em up stuff that takes little work and relieves stress, this is an alright game for you. And it's got some cool looking maps.
You will never play a better game than this. 10/10 perfect.

This game has elements of Left 4 Dead w.r.t. to it's interface and some of the game play. If you play L4D or L4D2 a lot you'll be at home when playing online co-op with three of your friends. The menus are exactly the same.   The game is playable; I just hope there will be a community creating extra maps for the game. What let the game down for me is the lack of weapon choice and the overall darkness of the maps as well as grainy graphics. Even when the graphics were maxed out it looked like a game from several years ago. With respect to weapons, what you get is a painkilleresque like weapon that's affixed to your arm. It's effective, but it would be nice to have some variety. To recharge health you pick up the hearts left by the natives you've killed. These restore anything from 5 to 15% of your health for each heart grabbed.  To be honest, I wish I'd waited until this game was on a deal despite it's already relative cheapness.
